vscode-origins-snippets.name: VS Code Origins Snippets
vscode-origins-snippets.desc:
A collection of snippets from the Origins Minecraft mod, made for VS Code!

Originally made for private use when I was taking comissions, but decided it would be a great idea to make it public for other people.

A fun project to experiment with web scraping!

rwOrigins.name: Rain World Origins
rwOrigins.desc:
A side project made public that implements some Rain World origins I made in my spare time. They're available on curseforge.

These are by far one of my best origin works outside of private comissions and tests. (BABA IS YOU will never see the light of day...)

KI.name: Kamali Origin
KI.desc:
One of my first Origins aswell. Its main gimmick is collecting flowers and confuming them, granting buffs for the wearer and those around them.
They're also unable to damage entities, but are able to stun and run away easily.

This was completly original and I quite like the final product!

BA.name: Bat Origin
BA.desc:
My second ever Origin. This was kind of a test, and later on the 'flapping' mechanic was reused on the squidcada origin, which is part of the "Rain World" origins pack.

I'm actually not sure if I heavily referenced anything, but knowing me, I probably did.

BT.name: Turtle Origin
BT.desc:
This was my first Origin ever. It used a different Origin as a base and I modified it afterwards, resulting in kind of a weird origin.
Very unbalanced!

But hey, learning happens, and you shouldn't be ashamed of it.

ugdev.name: Website / Portfolio
ugdev.desc:
My own website! It's been under constant development for a few years now, and its been one of the main things that's allowed me to learn more web development.

If you're interested, feel free to check the source code for references!
It's been made with my own two paws, and much, much love.

etv.name: Easy Tierlist Viewer (ETV)
etv.desc:
You know, one day I wanted to make a tierlist... So I did as any sane person would... And made a tierlist maker and viewer myself!

You're able to save and share tierlists with json, and I think it looks quite great!
Made in some days with base html/css/js.

secret.name: Secret... Pages?
secret.desc:
There's multiple hidden pages in this website, though they're a bit hard to find.

If you do, check them out! I've spent a long time preparing them and filling them with content or silly things to play around with.

adc.name: A Directionless Cycle
adc.desc:
A Directionless Cycle is a 2D Sokoban game where you explore a game that's slowly degrading, while you control multiple tiles with different directions at the same time.

My first commercial game ever, ~a year and a half of development, fully by me!
[ Get it on Steam! ]

gravix-eos.name: Gravix: EOS (WIP!)
gravix-eos.desc:
A new experience using the basic mechanics from VVVVVV, and giving them clever twists as you progress along the way.

This is a complete rework of "Gravix", with completely new content and mechanics.

gravix.name: Gravix
gravix.desc:
A Unity2D platformer with around 35 single screen levels, an interconnected map with collectibles to find and a final challenge waiting for you.

This game was inspired by "VVVVVV" by Terry Cavanagh, uses [ its soundtrack ] and shares multiple mechanics.

eos-cli.name: EOS Client (WIP!)
eos-cli.desc:
In development for... Specific reasons.

The EOS Client has ties with multiple games and other certain works of mine. If you're wondering, try looking around! You'll probably find more information about it.

sps.name: Space Potato Station (Game Jam)
sps.desc:
A gardening, puzzle game, resource management "college" game jam made with a bunch of friends and a limit of 8 hours to complete.

We didn't manage to finish the game in time, and so it is barely playable.
However, the design decisions we made are very creative and interesting.

boxfight.name: Box-Fight
boxfight.desc:
A Unity2D, top-down roguelike, shoot down enemies and buy new weapons as you try to clear every room possible in this procedurally generated world.

This was partially made with a friend in around a month and a half.
All assets used are from itch.io, and the soundtrack is from Ultrakill.

rework.name: A Directionless Cycle's OST
rework.desc:
My first ever "real" release! Even if a little basic...
This was made with ZERO music knowledge, and intended to be heard when playing my game, A Directionless Cycle.

[ Listen on Bandcamp. ]

slugTheFirst.name: Slugcat the first
slugTheFirst.tooltip: My first slugcat of the many I've drawn.

staringContest.name: Staring contest
staringContest.tooltip: A Rain World (tamed) lizard having a staring contest with a sluggo!

construxion.name: Construxion the armadillo
construxion.tooltip: A fella I made to practice animations in Unity.

fuckingKity.name: F**king kity
fuckingKity.tooltip: Kity! A kitty drawn on top of a hand, meow.

ruinedPebbles.name: Ruined Pebbles
ruinedPebbles.tooltip: Oops, this might be Rain World spoilers.

RWAM2023Gour.name: RWAM 2023 - Gourmand
RWAM2023Gour.tooltip: Honestly, one of my best slugs. Absolute unit.

RWAM2023Memory.name: RWAM 2023 - Memory Conflux
RWAM2023Memory.image: /assets/images/artwork/RWAM2023/Memory Conflux - Rain World Art Month 2023 D2.png
RWAM2023Memory.tooltip: First time doing backgrounds. Not so bad!

RWAM2023Spear.name: RWAM 2023 - Spearmaster
RWAM2023Spear.tooltip: Spearmaster will be rich in no time.

blenderCyanLiz.name: Cyan Lizard - Rain World
blenderCyanLiz.tooltip: A cyan lizard from Rain World! (Rain world brain-rot is real)

wysTranslator.name: Will You Snail Catalan Translator
wysTranslator.desc:
I'm one of the volunteer Catalan translators for the game Will You Snail, by Jonas Tyroller. It's a platformer game where an evil AI tries to kill you.

I contributed a bit, but never quite finished the translation sheet myself.

bootlegWordle.name: Bootleg Wordle
bootlegWordle.desc:
A bootleg version of wordle that was made in the C# console for fun.

It uses dictionary smaples from github, and is available to play in english and spanish.
You're also able to see a list of played games.

aStar.name: A* Pathfinding
aStar.desc: A simple pathfinding algorithm in Unity 3D/2D, it finds the closest path from one point to another using recursion.
